caption.p: Trophic amplification of marine biomass declines. Shown is the magnitude of projected mean changes in 2090–2099 relative to 1990–1999 (percent, ±SD) for NPP, phytoplankton, and zooplankton biomass derived from ESMs ( n = 2) and higher trophic levels from MEMs across four RCPs ( n = 10 for RCP2.6 and RCP8.5; n = 8 for RCP4.5 and RCP6.0). All ecosystem models use either NPP or phytoplankton biomass as forcing variables, and some also use zooplankton biomass.
